item.title: Report E-2024070509
item.description:
Report E-2024070509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN2582 Hydrex 3250 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cup of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the tote lid and body only due to a defective cap. The contractors replaced the cap with a new vented cap and wiped the tote down. A slosh test was conducted, and the tote was confirmed to be no longer leaking and was secured for shipment on. The impacted pads and cap were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024071427
item.description:
Report X-2024071427

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET AND LEAKING PACKAGE FOUND IN TRAILER #831825 ALREADY DAMAGED WET AND LEAKING UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 1 X 20 LITER PLASTIC BAG OF SODIUM HYDROXIDE 1.0N THE 20 LITER PLASTIC BAG WAS PUNCTURED BROKEN AND LEAKING ALLOWING 1 LITER TO RELEASE NO SLOTTED PARTITIIONS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. PACKAGE WAS A 20 LITER PLASTIC BAG INSIDE A INNER BOX INSIDE THE PACKAGE. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024070565
item.description:
Report E-2024070565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XHG contacted ERTS regarding several fallen boxes containing hazardous product, Contact-64. The boxes fell during transit as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. In total, (8) boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon plastic bottles of Contact 64 were damaged and/or impacted by released product. A Contractor estimated that 2-gallons of corrosive liquid released onto adjacent product, packaging including cardboard and shrink wrap/bubble-wrap, and the wooden trailer floor in a 8’x4’ area. Citric Acid was applied as a neutralizer and oil dry was laid down to absorb the release. Two drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 3-cups of Novacote NC-250/70-A was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture by XWC. The release impacted Dock Door 82. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When moving freight to load into trailer material handler noticed a jerrican staged on a pallet slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that a nail from the pallet had punctured the bottom of the pallet contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report E-2024070485
item.description:
Report E-2024070485

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight into a trailer forklift operator struck a pail already staged in the trailer with the forkblade on their forklift consequently puncturing the pail contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.
